intro: Pavetta gossweileri, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale pink, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Pavetta gossweileri is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in woodland or forested areas.
